body_content.explanation: a situation in which someone takes an amount of money that has been made available:
examples: There was no record of a drawdown of funds from the account.
The assembly approved a $400 million drawdown from the state's emergency fund.
The income drawdown plan allows you to keep your fund invested in the stock market after retirement while you draw an annual income from it.

body_content.explanation: a planned reduction in the number of soldiers in an area:
examples: There is likely to be a phased drawdown of US forces.
Some level of troop drawdown is expected because of the strain on military reserves.
